{"step_by_step_thinking": "The levator ani is a broad, thin muscle, situated on the side of the pelvis. It is attached to the inner surface of the side of the lesser pelvis, and unites with its fellow of the opposite side to form the floor of the pelvic cavity. So, option A is correct. The levator ani is made up of three parts: the pubococcygeus, the iliococcygeus, and the puborectalis. So, option B is correct. The fibers of these muscles are directed downwards and backwards, and are inserted into the coccyx, the prostate in males, and the vagina in females. So, option C is incorrect. The levator ani supports the pelvic viscera. So, option D is correct.", "answer_choice": "C"}
